channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: IUST at ClimateActivism 2024: Towards Optimal Stance Detection: A Systematic Study of Architectural Choices and Data Cleaning Techniques
item.description: This work presents a systematic search of various model architecture configurations and data cleaning methods.

item.title: A Unified Framework for Model Editing
item.description: With EMMET, we present a closed form solution for the equality-constrained version of the preservation-memorization objective.

item.title: Enhancing Historical Image Retrieval with Compositional Cues
item.description: In analyzing vast amounts of digitally stored historical image data, existing content-based retrieval methods often overlook significant non-semantic information, limiting their effectiveness for flexible exploration across varied themes.

item.title: Detoxifying Large Language Models via Knowledge Editing
item.description: This paper investigates using knowledge editing techniques to detoxify Large Language Models (LLMs).

item.title: Empowering Segmentation Ability to Multi-modal Large Language Models
item.description: Multi-modal large language models (MLLMs) can understand image-language prompts and demonstrate impressive reasoning ability.

item.title: Reactor Optimization Benchmark by Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Neutronic calculations for reactors are a daunting task when using Monte Carlo (MC) methods.

item.title: Pensieve: Retrospect-then-Compare Mitigates Visual Hallucination
item.description: Multi-modal Large Language Models (MLLMs) demonstrate remarkable success across various vision-language tasks.

item.title: Recovering Latent Confounders from High-dimensional Proxy Variables
item.description: Detecting latent confounders from proxy variables is an essential problem in causal effect estimation.

item.title: On the Concept Trustworthiness in Concept Bottleneck Models
item.description: Concept Bottleneck Models (CBMs), which break down the reasoning process into the input-to-concept mapping and the concept-to-label prediction, have garnered significant attention due to their remarkable interpretability achieved by the interpretable concept bottleneck.

item.title: T-Rex2: Towards Generic Object Detection via Text-Visual Prompt Synergy
item.description: Recognizing the complementary strengths and weaknesses of both text and visual prompts, we introduce T-Rex2 that synergizes both prompts within a single model through contrastive learning.

item.title: A Lightweight Attention-based Deep Network via Multi-Scale Feature Fusion for Multi-View Facial Expression Recognition
item.description: On the other hand, the PWFS block employs a feature selection mechanism that discards less meaningful features prior to the fusion process.

item.title: Impact Assessment of Missing Data in Model Predictions for Earth Observation Applications
item.description: In this work, we assess the impact of missing temporal and static EO sources in trained models across four datasets with classification and regression tasks.

item.title: Diffusion Models with Ensembled Structure-Based Anomaly Scoring for Unsupervised Anomaly Detection
item.description: We demonstrate that this ensembling strategy can enhance the performance of DMs and mitigate the sensitivity to different kernel sizes across varying pathologies, highlighting its promise for brain MRI anomaly detection.

item.title: MVSplat: Efficient 3D Gaussian Splatting from Sparse Multi-View Images
item.description: We propose MVSplat, an efficient feed-forward 3D Gaussian Splatting model learned from sparse multi-view images.

item.title: SoftPatch: Unsupervised Anomaly Detection with Noisy Data
item.description: Noise discriminators are utilized to generate outlier scores for patch-level noise elimination before coreset construction.

item.title: Deep Learning for Trajectory Data Management and Mining: A Survey and Beyond
item.description: In this paper, we present a comprehensive review of the development and recent advances in deep learning for trajectory computing (DL4Traj).

item.title: Genetic Programming for Explainable Manifold Learning
item.description: Our experimental analysis demonstrates that GP-EMaL is able to match the performance of the existing approach in most cases, while using simpler, smaller, and more interpretable tree structures.

item.title: Improving Image Classification Accuracy through Complementary Intra-Class and Inter-Class Mixup
item.description: Moreover, our integrated solution seamlessly combines our intra-class mixup method with an existing mixup approach such as MixUp or Manifold MixUp.

item.title: A reinforcement learning guided hybrid evolutionary algorithm for the latency location routing problem
item.description: The latency location routing problem integrates the facility location problem and the multi-depot cumulative capacitated vehicle routing problem.

item.title: Less but Better: Enabling Generalized Zero-shot Learning Towards Unseen Domains by Intrinsic Learning from Redundant LLM Semantics
item.description: Different from existing GZSL methods which alleviate DSP by generating features of unseen classes with semantics, CDGZSL needs to construct a common feature space across domains and acquire the corresponding intrinsic semantics shared among domains to transfer from seen to unseen domains.

item.title: WikiFactDiff: A Large, Realistic, and Temporally Adaptable Dataset for Atomic Factual Knowledge Update in Causal Language Models
item.description: To study this task, we present WikiFactDiff, a dataset that describes the evolution of factual knowledge between two dates as a collection of simple facts divided into three categories: new, obsolete, and static.

item.title: Knowledge-Enhanced Recommendation with User-Centric Subgraph Network
item.description: Recommendation systems, as widely implemented nowadays on various platforms, recommend relevant items to users based on their preferences.

item.title: Can ChatGPT Detect DeepFakes? A Study of Using Multimodal Large Language Models for Media Forensics
item.description: DeepFakes, which refer to AI-generated media content, have become an increasing concern due to their use as a means for disinformation.

item.title: DomainLab: A modular Python package for domain generalization in deep learning
item.description: DomainLab is a modular Python package for training user specified neural networks with composable regularization loss terms.

item.title: HAC: Hash-grid Assisted Context for 3D Gaussian Splatting Compression
item.description: 3D Gaussian Splatting (3DGS) has emerged as a promising framework for novel view synthesis, boasting rapid rendering speed with high fidelity.

item.title: CombiNeRF: A Combination of Regularization Techniques for Few-Shot Neural Radiance Field View Synthesis
item.description: When dealing with few-shot settings, i. e. with a small set of input views, the training could overfit those views, leading to artifacts and geometric and chromatic inconsistencies in the resulting rendering.

item.title: PSALM: Pixelwise SegmentAtion with Large Multi-Modal Model
item.description: PSALM is a powerful extension of the Large Multi-modal Model (LMM) to address the segmentation task challenges.

item.title: Open-Vocabulary Attention Maps with Token Optimization for Semantic Segmentation in Diffusion Models
item.description: This approach limits the generation of segmentation masks derived from word tokens not contained in the text prompt.

item.title: View-decoupled Transformer for Person Re-identification under Aerial-ground Camera Network
item.description: Experiments on two datasets show that VDT is a feasible and effective solution for AGPReID, surpassing the previous method on mAP/Rank1 by up to 5. 0%/2. 7% on CARGO and 3. 7%/5. 2% on AG-ReID, keeping the same magnitude of computational complexity.

item.title: emoDARTS: Joint Optimisation of CNN & Sequential Neural Network Architectures for Superior Speech Emotion Recognition
item.description: This study presents emoDARTS, a DARTS-optimised joint CNN and Sequential Neural Network (SeqNN: LSTM, RNN) architecture that enhances SER performance.

item.title: Machine-learning invariant foliations in forced systems for reduced order modelling
item.description: We identify reduced order models (ROM) of forced systems from data using invariant foliations.

item.title: MMIDR: Teaching Large Language Model to Interpret Multimodal Misinformation via Knowledge Distillation
item.description: Automatic detection of multimodal misinformation has gained a widespread attention recently.

item.title: Language Repository for Long Video Understanding
item.description: In this paper, we introduce a Language Repository (LangRepo) for LLMs, that maintains concise and structured information as an interpretable (i. e., all-textual) representation.

item.title: Transfer Learning for Cross-dataset Isolated Sign Language Recognition in Under-Resourced Datasets
item.description: Sign language recognition (SLR) has recently achieved a breakthrough in performance thanks to deep neural networks trained on large annotated sign datasets.

item.title: GLC++: Source-Free Universal Domain Adaptation through Global-Local Clustering and Contrastive Affinity Learning
item.description: GLC++ enhances the novel category clustering accuracy of GLC by 4. 3% in open-set scenarios on Office-Home.

item.title: RAmBLA: A Framework for Evaluating the Reliability of LLMs as Assistants in the Biomedical Domain
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) increasingly support applications in a wide range of domains, some with potential high societal impact such as biomedicine, yet their reliability in realistic use cases is under-researched.

item.title: Text-Enhanced Data-free Approach for Federated Class-Incremental Learning
item.description: In this field, Data-Free Knowledge Transfer (DFKT) plays a crucial role in addressing catastrophic forgetting and data privacy problems.

item.title: HETAL: Efficient Privacy-preserving Transfer Learning with Homomorphic Encryption
item.description: Although numerous previous studies proposed to use homomorphic encryption to resolve the data privacy issue in transfer learning in the machine learning as a service setting, most of them only focused on encrypted inference.

item.title: ChainLM: Empowering Large Language Models with Improved Chain-of-Thought Prompting
item.description: In response to this challenge, we present an empirical investigation of CoT prompting and introduce CoTGenius, a novel framework designed for the automatic generation of superior CoT prompts.

item.title: Loop Improvement: An Efficient Approach for Extracting Shared Features from Heterogeneous Data without Central Server
item.description: LI integrates a loop topology with layer-wise and end-to-end training, compatible with various neural network models.

item.title: Unleashing Unlabeled Data: A Paradigm for Cross-View Geo-Localization
item.description: This paper investigates the effective utilization of unlabeled data for large-area cross-view geo-localization (CVGL), encompassing both unsupervised and semi-supervised settings.

item.title: HyperGALE: ASD Classification via Hypergraph Gated Attention with Learnable Hyperedges
item.description: Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) is a neurodevelopmental condition characterized by varied social cognitive challenges and repetitive behavioral patterns.

item.title: Hierarchical Text-to-Vision Self Supervised Alignment for Improved Histopathology Representation Learning
item.description: Self-supervised representation learning has been highly promising for histopathology image analysis with numerous approaches leveraging their patient-slide-patch hierarchy to learn better representations.

item.title: GRM: Large Gaussian Reconstruction Model for Efficient 3D Reconstruction and Generation
item.description: We introduce GRM, a large-scale reconstructor capable of recovering a 3D asset from sparse-view images in around 0. 1s.

item.title: LlamaFactory: Unified Efficient Fine-Tuning of 100+ Language Models
item.description: Efficient fine-tuning is vital for adapting large language models (LLMs) to downstream tasks.

item.title: A Sampling-based Framework for Hypothesis Testing on Large Attributed Graphs
item.description: Experiments on real datasets demonstrate the ability of our framework to leverage common graph sampling methods for hypothesis testing, and the superiority of hypothesis-aware sampling in terms of accuracy and time efficiency.

item.title: Meta-Point Learning and Refining for Category-Agnostic Pose Estimation
item.description: Existing methods only rely on the features extracted at support keypoints to predict or refine the keypoints on query image, but a few support feature vectors are local and inadequate for CAPE.

item.title: DESIRE-ME: Domain-Enhanced Supervised Information REtrieval using Mixture-of-Experts
item.description: Open-domain question answering requires retrieval systems able to cope with the diverse and varied nature of questions, providing accurate answers across a broad spectrum of query types and topics.

item.title: Grounding Spatial Relations in Text-Only Language Models
item.description: This paper shows that text-only Language Models (LM) can learn to ground spatial relations like "left of" or "below" if they are provided with explicit location information of objects and they are properly trained to leverage those locations.

item.title: PuzzleVQA: Diagnosing Multimodal Reasoning Challenges of Language Models with Abstract Visual Patterns
item.description: As recognizing patterns and abstracting concepts are key to general intelligence, we introduce PuzzleVQA, a collection of puzzles based on abstract patterns.
